metadata.title: CVE-2018-15864 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Unchecked NULL pointer usage in resolve_keysym in xkbcomp/parser.y inxkbcommon before 0.8.2 could be used by local attackers to crash (NULLpointer dereference) the xkbcommon parser by supplying a crafted keymapfile, because a map access attempt can occur for a map that was nevercreated.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15864` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxkbcommon-x11-0 - 0.4.1-0ubuntu1.1
libxkbcommon0 - 0.4.1-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxkbcommon package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4.1-0ubuntu1.1').
